name.description: Full-stack developer. Third year computer science student.

description.first: I am a passionate full-stack developer who is looking to hone his skills and develop intuitive, beautiful and most importantly secure applications. Currently I am studying in my third year at Klaipėdos valstybinė kolegija / Higher education institution.
description.second: I learned a lot during study years by doing multiple projects. I did not hold back to take on completely new things by myself or with my colleagues and I developed projects using Node.js, Express.js, Nuxt 3, Android Studio, Docker and so on.
description.third: Developed in an agile environment and I know basics of it and so the importance of communication, teamwork and taking the initiative to succesfully deliver a result.
description.fourth: In my leisure time I enjoy playing video games, fishing, watching videos on youtube and sometimes learning new things such as video editing, Blender, Unreal Engine or modding games in general.

jobPortal.title: Job Listings Portal
jobPortal.description: A job portal where you can find or post a job. Developed along with two other colleagues, we explored the MERN stack. I mainly worked on back-end side of it building authentication and other features with Passport.js. Scientific paper about this project was presented at KVK technology conference.

smartHome.title: Smart Home System Solutions App
smartHome.description: A mobile Android application that helps you to decide which smart home system is suitable for the client. Developed along with three other students. I was responsible for being a Scrum master and doing front-end in an agile work environment.
smartHome.detailedDescription: App guides user through a series of questions and based on the answers it suggests a smart home system that would be suitable for the client. It also provides information about the systems and links to the official website of the systems providers.

recipeApp.title: Recipe App
recipeApp.description: I wanted to dive deeper into mobile app development and so the result was an Android application for finding and sharing recipes. Developed solo as a project for coursework. Users can view, search, filter, rate recipes and share their own.
recipeApp.detailedDescription: Only registered users can rate and share recipes, JWT is used for authentication. The app also has a feature to add recipes to favorites and view them later.

scrolle.title: Learning Management System „Scrolle“
scrolle.description: LMS – Learning Management System developed from scratch by three students for an internship project abroad. I was responsible for the back-end, building and designing micro-services to provide a scalable project. Sometimes I assisted in the front-end.
scrolle.detailedDescription: The idea was similar to Moodle but instead we put heavy focus on user experience to create an easy to use, fast and safe LMS. It was a huge challenge for my colleagues and me but we delivered a minimal prototype in three months and we learned a lot. Back-end utilizes Docker to containerize the services and Traefik for easier routing. Authentication was built securely with access and refresh JWT’s, guest users that can attend free courses can also login with facebook or google. Micro-services were deployed on Google Cloud Run.

college.title: Informatics Student
college.location: Klaipėdos valstybinė kolegija / Higher Education Institution. Klaipėda, Lithuania
college.description: During my studies, I experienced development of various projects like websites, mobile applications, games and augmented reality stuff using technologies such as Nuxt, Android Studio, Unreal Engine 5, Godot Engine and so on. As well as useful theory about object-oriented programming, design patterns and agile environment.

turiba.title: 3 Month Internship Abroad
turiba.description: In this internship I went together with two other KVK students. We were tasked with designing and creating an LMS – Learning Management System prototype from scratch. I was responsible alone for the back-end, designing and creating micro-services. Sometimes I was assisting in the front-end.
